etymology.description: 淮 (Huai River) + 海 (sea/coastal area) = region from the Huai River toward the sea.
etymology.interpretation: Names the area around the Huai River and adjacent coastal plain, especially in today’s Jiangsu and northern Anhui. Common in toponyms and historical references such as 淮海战役 and 淮海路.

parts.english: Huai River; Huai region; toponymic element; related to Huai area

examples.chinese: 学者常用“淮海”指称淮河流域与沿海平原(學者常用「淮海」指稱淮河流域與沿海平原)。
examples.pinyin: Xuézhě cháng yòng “Huáihǎi” zhǐchēng Huáihé liúyù yǔ yánhǎi píngyuán.
examples.english: Scholars often use “Huaihai” to refer to the Huai River basin and the coastal plain.

examples.chinese: 淮海战役影响深远(淮海戰役影響深遠)。
examples.english: The Huaihai Campaign had far-reaching impact.

examples.chinese: 上海的淮海路很繁华(上海的淮海路很繁華)，吸引了众多游客(吸引了眾多遊客)。
examples.pinyin: Shànghǎi de Huáihǎi Lù hěn fánhuá, xīyǐnle zhòngduō yóukè.
examples.english: Shanghai’s Huaihai Road is very bustling, attracting many visitors.
